title: Theresa May appears to accuse Boris Johnson of being preoccupied with headlines rather than finding solutions
text:
Theresa May appeared to accuse Boris Johnson of being preoccupied with headlines and configuring “arresting phrasing” than delivering solutions everyday problems people face.

In what will be seen as a thinly veiled attack on the Mr Johnson Mrs May used her first political intervention since standing down as Prime Minister to question Monday’s Queen’s Speech.

Addressing the Commons Mrs May noted that while there were “many other bills” within the Speech that would improve the quality of life of many people, it needed to be recognised “actually it’s not about headlines”.

“Governing is about delivering practical solutions to the problems that people face day-to-day,” she said.
